title: start here
overview: Group of channels to help people join the Discord, learn about channels, and verify assets.

channels.name: collabland-join
channels.description: Technically lives right outside this section, but it's the place to both verify you're not a bot when joining the Discord for the first time as well as verifying your Noun NFT to gain your `Nouner` role.

channels.name: welcome
channels.description: Where you land when you first join the Discord. No tangible purpose and history non-viewable.

channels.name: getting-started
channels.description: Overview of all channel groups in the Discord. It functions a lot like this page does.

channels.name: verify
channels.description: Old verification channel/method. Replaced by #collabland-join.

channels.name: announcements
channels.description: Not used anymore, but it is where community-wide announcements were posted.

title: nounsdao
overview: Only Noun owners can write in these, but anyone can read them.

channels.name: nouner-general
channels.description: An all-purpose chat for Nouners (Noun owners).

channels.name: treasury-management
channels.description: Discussion around the treasury: how to use, protect, and grow it.

channels.name: dao-security
channels.description: Conversations about mitigations for possible future social or 51% attacks on the DAO.

title: community
overview: The main set of non-project related channels to be used by anyone.

channels.name: general
channels.description: The main discussion channel for what's going on on a daily basis. Before adding links or asking questions, take a read through other channels to see which may be a better fit.

channels.name: nouniverse
channels.description: Stands for 'Nouns Universe' and is where all extension projects can post updates on their Nounish projects, art, and creations.

channels.name: developers
channels.description: A place to ask technical questions about the Nouns code and contracts.

channels.name: proposal-ideas
channels.description: Post your project idea here if you want initial feedback on it before putting it on Discourse for more scrutiny. This channel can often be used as a 'temp check' or sanity check' before moving forward.

channels.name: grants-and-retro-funding
channels.description: The Small Grants & Retro Funding Committee's channel to announce projects they've awarded funding to or discuss projects asking for it. You can ask questions about your project's merit here.

channels.name: discourse-notifications
channels.description: A read-only channel that a bot sends notifications to anytime a new comment or post is made, by anyone, on Disourse.

channels.name: nouns-otc
channels.description: 'OTC' means 'Over the counter' and is in reference to buying Nouns. If you want to buy/sell a Noun you can try striking a deal here before going to secondary markets.

channels.name: subdaos
channels.description: Discussion around DAOs/groups created to buy Nouns or participate in Nouns governance.

channels.name: voice-public-text
channels.description: A 'sibling' text channel to drop links & images being referenced in #voice-public.

channels.name: voice-public
channels.description: A drop-in voice channel. Anyone can join and instantly be a part of whatever conversation is going on.

title: community-projects
overview: Set of projects by and for the community. These are community or DAO efforts not funded via proposal.

channels.name: noundry
channels.description: Stands for 'Nouns Foundry'. On the Nouns anniversary, August 8th, new traits will be added. Submit your ideas here to be considered.

channels.name: nouns-physicals
channels.description: Share any physicals Nouns ideas. Whether it be toys, glasses, pins, clothing etc. This is where IRL Nouns products are discussed.

channels.name: nouns-ai
channels.description: Updates on Noun 355: the first AI-controlled Nouns DAO member.

channels.name: nouns-clients
channels.description: Fudning teams to build alternatives nouns.wtf frontends.

channels.name: writers-room
channels.description: Ongoing effort to write stories, scripts, and/or screenplays about Nouns.

channels.name: cryptovoxels
channels.description: Project to create a Nounish space in the Voxels virtual world.

channels.name: 1-click-nounsdao
channels.description: This project is both a product & protocol that will allow anyone to deploy a fully functional Nouns DAO fork in just a few clicks and with 0 code.

title: international
overview: A '#general' channel for our growing international communities.

channels.name: „ÄåüáØüáµÊó•Êú¨Ë™û„Äç
channels.description: Home to the Japanese community and was the first international channel.

channels.name: üáßüá∑-portugu√™s
channels.description: A place for Portuguese speakers and the NounsDAO Brazil efforts.

channels.name: espa√±ol
channels.description: The channel for Spanish-speakers and the NounsDAO Amigos project.

channels.name: ‰∏≠Êñá
channels.description: The channel for the Chinese NounsDAO community.

title: funded-proposals
overview: Every funded proposal gets its own channel to discuss things specific to it. You can ask proposal-specific questions in their respective channel.

channels.name: [num]-[name]
channels.description: Every funded proposal gets its own channel to discuss things specific to it. Won't listen them all here, but they follow the same format of 'proposal num & proposal name'. You can ask proposal-specific questions in their respective channel.

title: nouncil
overview: Stands for 'The Nouns Council' and is the group of builders who govern a Nouns delegated to them.

channels.name: nouncil
channels.description: The '#general' channel for the Nouncil.

channels.name: nouncil-votes
channels.description: Nouncillors use emoji-based voting for how they will, as a group, vote on official proposals.
